seo.meta_description_en: The Basal Energy Expenditure calculates daily energy expenditure.
seo.keywords_en: Basal Energy Expenditure, basal, BEE, energy expenditure, energy male, energy female, energy weight, energy obesity, basal energy expense, basal energy calc, basal energy score, basal energy calculator, energy expense calc, energy expense score, energy expenditure calc, energy expenditure md, energy expenditure basal, energy expenditure obesity, BEE calc, BEE score, BEE calculate, BEE calculator, BEE online, BEE MDCalc, basal EE calc

how_to_use.pearls_pitfalls_en: Recall that this is simply the basal, i.e., minimum daily needs. Activity will increase this substantially.

next_steps.advice_en: Note: stress, activity, illness, trauma, burns, cancers can increase daily caloric requirement.

about.formula_en:
Note: The Basal Energy Expenditure must be multiplied by activity and stress factors to calculate total caloric requirement.

BEE, kcal/day (male) = 66.5 + (13.75 × weight, kg) + (5.003 × height, cm) - (6.775 × age)

BEE, kcal/day (female) = 655.1 + (9.563 × weight, kg) + (1.850 × height, cm) - (4.676 × age)

Harris-Benedict adjustment:

  • Sedentary (little to no exercise) = BEE × 1.2
  • Light exercise (1-3 days per week) = BEE × 1.375
  • Moderate exercise (3–5 days per week) = BEE × 1.55
  • Heavy exercise (6–7 days per week) = BEE × 1.725
  • Very heavy exercise (twice per day, extra heavy workouts) = BEE × 1.9

Original/Primary Reference.text: Harris J, Benedict F. A biometric study of basal metabolism in man. Washington D.C. Carnegie Institute of Washington. 1919.

creator_info.about_en: J. P. Flatt, PhD, is a professor emeritus of Biochemistry and Molecular Pharmacology at the University of Massachusetts. His research focuses on metabolic processes of fat breakdown, obesity and physical activity.
